definition: Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: Anthropology is the core of Feuerbach's philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 人本学是费尔巴哈哲学的核心。

definition: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
Friedrich Engels (1820-1895), socialist philosopher and one of the founder of Marxism
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
surname Althusser/Louis Pierre Althusser 路易·皮埃爾·阿爾都塞|路易·皮埃尔·阿尔都塞[Lu4 yi4 · Pi2 ai1 er3 · A1 er3 dou1 sai1] (1918-1990), Marxist philosopher
